tournament.name: Bohemia Commander Tournament (Hradec Kralove, Czech republic)

decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and take advantage of Animar, Soul of Elements' ability to reduce the cost of your creature spells. By using efficient mana dorks, card draw, and tutoring effects, the deck aims to quickly assemble powerful combos using creatures like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Zealous Conscripts to create infinite creature tokens or untap loops. The deck also includes control elements like counterspells and removal spells to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to generate explosive turns and overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of creatures and game-winning combos before they can respond.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and card advantage, using counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw to outvalue opponents. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, while setting up its own win condition through efficient threats like Vendilion Clique, True-Name Nemesis, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes powerful utility lands like Wasteland and Maze of Ith to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game, making it difficult for opponents to execute their game plan while setting up its own win conditions to close out the game.

This deck focuses on using Narset, Enlightened Master as the commander to control the game and outvalue opponents. It includes a variety of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset Transcendent, as well as efficient counterspells and removal spells to control the board. The deck also includes extra turn spells and card draw to generate card advantage and pull ahead in the game. It aims to disrupt opponents' plans while setting up for powerful plays with Narset's ability to cast spells for free. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells. The overall strategy revolves around using Narset's abilities to dominate the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Tasigur, the Golden Fang as the commander to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck includes a wide range of versatile control cards such as Snapcaster Mage, Venser, Shaper Savant, and Vendilion Clique to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes powerful spell recursion cards like Eternal Witness and Ancestral Vision to maintain consistency and resilience. The deck is designed to outvalue opponents with strong card advantage engines like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Fact or Fiction, while also having access to powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Intuition to assemble key pieces. The goal is to control the game until you can overwhelm the opponent with threats like Primeval Titan and Titania, Protector of Argoth.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. Geist of Saint Traft serves as the commander and win condition, backed up by powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords. The deck includes a wide range of control elements such as counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Will, board wipes like Wrath of God and Supreme Verdict, and disruptive creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Meddling Mage. The deck's mana base is designed to support its control strategy with lands like Tundra and Tectonic Edge. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while maintaining card advantage and eventually winning with Geist of Saint Traft.

The primary strategy of this deck is to utilize Marath, Will of the Wild as the commander to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck includes a variety of ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Elvish Mystic to quickly build up mana for powerful plays. Additionally, the deck includes utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Reclamation Sage to provide versatility and answer opponent's threats. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes various tutor effects like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to find key pieces when needed. Lastly, the deck includes powerful equipment like Swords of Feast and Famine and Sword of Fire and Ice to enhance the power of the creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Prime Speaker Zegana as the commander to generate card advantage and ramp up quickly. The main strategy revolves around assembling a board presence of powerful creatures with ETB effects and strong synergy with Zegana's ability to draw more cards. The deck features a variety of mana ramp cards, counterspells, and removal spells to control the board while setting up for explosive turns with cards like Birthing Pod and Greater Good. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggro threats and card advantage, creating a strong tempo advantage and closing out the game quickly.

This deck revolves around utilizing powerful control spells and cards to disrupt your opponent's strategy while maintaining advantage on the board. With a strong suite of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, you aim to control the game until you can drop your powerful finishers such as Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker or Cruel Ultimatum. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure you have access to all the colors you need to cast your spells efficiently. By managing your resources effectively and making calculated decisions, you can outmaneuver your opponent and secure victory through sheer control and overwhelming power.
